a.g: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إذا أردت أن تسأل الله حاجة فاقرأ خمس آيات من أول سورة الحديد إلى قوله عليم بذات الصدور ومن آخر سورة الحشر من قوله لو أنزلنا هذا القرآن على جبل إلى آخر السورة ثم تقول يا من هو كذا افعل بي كذا وتدعو بما تريد.
If you wish to ask Allah for a need, then recite five verses from the beginning of Surah Al-Hadid to His saying, "All-Knowing of what is in the breasts [‘Alīmun bi-dhāti al-ṣudūr]," and from the end of Surah Al-Hashr from His saying, "Had We sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain..." to the end of the Surah. Then say, "O You Who is such-and-such, do with me such-and-such," and supplicate for what you desire.

a.g: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is, of all things, Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بل "هو الأول والآخر والظاهر والباطن وهو بكل شيء عليم". التنزيه: وأنه ليس بجسم مصور ولا جوهر محدود مقدر وأنه لا يماثل والأجسام ولا في التقدير ولا في قبول الانقسام وأنه ليس بجوهر ولا تحله الجواهر ولا بعرض ولا تحله الأعراض بل لا يماثل موجوداً ولا يماثله موجود "ليس كمثله شيء" ولا هو مثل شيء.
Indeed, "He is the First [al-Awwal] and the Last [al-Akhir], the Manifest [al-Zahir] and the Hidden [al-Batin], and He is, of all things, Knowing [ʿAlīm]." The Transcendence [al-Tanzih]: That He is not a formed body [jism musawwar] nor a limited, measured substance [jawhar mahdud muqaddar], and that He does not resemble bodies [al-ajsam]—not in measure, nor in accepting division. And that He is not a substance [jawhar] nor do substances indwell Him, nor is He an accident [ʿaraḍ] nor do accidents indwell Him. Rather, He does not resemble any existent [mawjud], nor does any existent resemble Him. "There is nothing like unto Him," nor is He like anything.

a.g: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل الثامن: العلم بأنه تعالى مستو على عرشه بالمعنى الذي أراد الله تعالى بالاستواء وهو الذي لا ينافي وصف الكبرياء ولا يتطرق إليه سمات الحدوث والفناء وهو الذي أريد بالاستواء إلى السماء حيث قال في القرآن ثم استوى إلى السماء وهي دخان وليس ذلك إلا بطريق القهر والاستيلاء كما قال الشاعر: قد استوى بشر على العراق من غير سيف ودم مهراق واضطرّ أهل الحق إلى هذا التأويل كما التأويل كما اضطر أهل الباطن إلى تأويل قوله تعالى وهو معكم أينما كنتم إذ حمل ذلك بالاتفاق على الإحاطة والعلم وحمل قوله ﭬ قلب المؤمن بين أصبعين من أصابع الرحمن على القدرة والقوة وحمل قوله ﭬ الحجر الأسود يمين الله في أرضه على التشريف والإكرام لأنه لو ترك على ظاهره للزم منه المحال فكذا الاستواء لو ترك على الاستقرار والتمكن لزم منه كون المتمكن جسما مماسا للعرش إما مثله أو أكبر منه أو أصغر وذلك محال وما يؤدي إلى المحال فهو محال.
The Eighth Foundation: The knowledge that He, the Exalted, is established [istawa] upon His Throne [arsh] by the meaning which God, the Exalted, intended by 'establishment' [istawa']—and it is that which does not contradict the attribute of majesty [kibriya'] nor is it subject to the marks of origination [huduth] and annihilation [fana']. And it is that which is intended by 'He turned to the heaven' [istawa ila al-sama'] where He said in the Qur'an: "Then He turned to the heaven, and it was smoke." And that is only by way of overpowering [qahr] and mastery [istila'], as the poet said: Bishr has established himself over Iraq Without a sword and without bloodshed. And the people of truth [ahl al-haqq] were compelled to this interpretation [ta'wil], just as the people of inward meaning [ahl al-batin] were compelled to interpret His saying, the Exalted: "And He is with you wherever you are"—since it was agreed to understand that as encompassing [ihata] and knowledge [ilm]. And to interpret His saying, "The heart [qalb] of the believer is between two fingers of the fingers of the Most Merciful" as power [qudra] and strength [quwwa]. And to interpret His saying, "The Black Stone is the right hand of God on His earth" as honor [tashrif] and veneration [ikram]. For if it were left according to its outward [zahir] meaning, impossibility [muhal] would necessarily follow from it. Likewise, the establishment [istawa']—if it were left according to settling [istiqrar] and taking position [tamakkun], it would necessarily follow from it that the one taking position is a body [jism] in contact with the Throne [arsh], either equal to it, larger than it, or smaller than it, and that is impossible [muhal]. And whatever leads to impossibility is itself impossible.

a.g: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and he is Knowing of that within the breasts.
Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward.
And why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?
It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muhammad] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allah is to you Kind and Merciful.

And why do you not spend in the cause of Allah while to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allah has promised the best [reward]. And Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد قال تعالى: ﴿ لا يستوي منكم من أنفق من قبل الفتح وقاتل ﴾ {} الآية. وقد قال تعالى: ﴿ هم درجات عند الله ﴾ {} فهذا ما يدل على ارتباط كمال الإيمان بالأعمال.
Indeed, the Most High has said: "Not equal among you are those who spent before the Conquest and fought..." [Qur'an 57:10]. And indeed, the Most High has said: "They are degrees with Allah [Allah]" [Qur'an 8:4]. This is what indicates the connection of the perfection of faith [al-iman] with deeds [al-a'mal].

a.g: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن قلت: فقد حث الشرع على الأعمال وبالغ في ذكر فضلها حتى طلب الصدقات بقوله: ﴿ من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا ﴾ {} وقال تعالى: ﴿ ويأخذ الصدقات ﴾ {} فكيف لا يكون الفعل والإنفاق هو الأفضل. فاعلم أن الطبيب إذا أثنى على الدواء لم يدل على أن الدواء مراد لعينه أو على أنه أفضل من الصحة والشفاء الحاصل به ولكن الأعمال علاج لمرض القلوب ومرض القلوب مما لا يشعر به غالبا فهو كبرص على وجه من لا مرآة معه فإنه لا يشعر به ولو ذكر له لا يصدق به والسبيل معه المبالغة في الثناء على غسل الوجه بماء الورد مثلا إن كان ماء الورد يزيل البرص حتى يستحثه فرط الثناء على المواظبة عليه فيزول مرضه فإنه لو ذكر له أن المقصود زوال البرص عن وجهك ربما ترك العلاج وزعم أن وجهه لا عيب فيه. وقد انخدع بمثل هذا الخيال طائفة وسلكوا طريق الإباحة وقالوا إن الله تعالى غنى عن عبادتنا وعن أن يستقرض منا فأي معنى لقوله: ﴿ من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا ﴾ {}
Indeed, if you say: "The Sacred Law [shar'] has urged upon works [a'mal] and emphasized the mention of their merit, to the point of seeking alms [sadaqat] with His saying: 'Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan...' [57:11], and He, the Exalted, said: 'And He accepts the charities...' [9:104]. So how can action [fi'l] and spending [infāq] not be the superior thing?" Then know that when the physician praises the medicine, it does not indicate that the medicine itself is the desired end, or that it is superior to the health [sihha] and the cure [shifa'] attained through it. Rather, the works [a'mal] are a treatment [‘ilāj] for the sickness [marad] of the hearts [qulūb]. And the sickness of the hearts is something most people are not aware of. It is like leprosy [baras] on the face of one who has no mirror with him; he is not aware of it, and if it were mentioned to him, he would not believe it. The way with him is to exaggerate in praising the washing of the face with rosewater, for example—if rosewater removes the leprosy—so that he is spurred on by the extreme praise for persisting in it, and thus his sickness is removed. For if it were mentioned to him that the intended purpose is the removal of leprosy from your face, he might abandon the treatment and claim that his face has no blemish. A group [ta'ifa] has been deceived by a fantasy [khayal] like this and have taken the path of permissiveness [ibāha], saying: "Allah, the Exalted, is independent of our worship ['ibādatina] and of borrowing from us, so what meaning is there to His saying: 'Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan...' [57:11]?"

a.g: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فالمعارف أنوار ولا يسعى المؤمنون إلى لقاء الله تعالى إلا بأنوارهم قال الله تعالى يسعى نورهم بين أيديهم وبأيمانهم وقد روي في الخبر إن بعضهم يعطي نورا مثل الجبل وبعضهم أصغر حتى يكون آخرهم رجلا يعطي نورا على إبهام قدميه فيضيء مرة وينطفيء أخرى فإذا أضاء قدم قدميه فمشى وإذا طفيء قام ومرورهم على الصراط على قدر نورهم فمنهم من يمر كطرف العين ومنهم من يمر كالبرق ومنهم من يمر كالسحاب ومنه من يمر كانقضاض الكواكب ومنهم من يمر كالفرس إذا اشتد في ميدانه والذي أعطى نورا على إبهام قدمه يحبوحبوا على وجهه ويديه ورجليه يجر يدا ويعلق أخرى ويصيب جوانبه النار فلا يزال كذلك حتى يخلص
Indeed, the knowledges [ma'arif] are lights [anwar], and the believers do not strive to meet Allah, the Exalted, except by their lights. Allah, the Exalted, has said: "Their light [nur] runs before them and on their right hands." And it has been narrated in the report that some of them are given a light [nur] like a mountain, and some of them smaller, until the last of them is a man who is given a light [nur] upon the tip of his toe. It illuminates once and is extinguished another. So when it illuminates, he places his foot and walks, and when it is extinguished, he stands. And their crossing over the Path [al-Sirat] is according to the measure of their light [nur]. Among them is he who passes like the blink of an eye, and among them is he who passes like lightning, and among them is he who passes like clouds, and among them is he who passes like the shooting of stars, and among them is he who passes like a horse when it charges in its arena. And he who was given a light [nur] upon the tip of his toe crawls upon his face and his hands and his legs, dragging one hand and hanging another, and the sides of him are struck by the Fire. He does not cease to be like that until he is delivered.

a.g: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله تعالى: " انظرونا نقتبس من نوركم - قيل ارجعوا وراءكم فالتمسوا نوراً" يدل على أن الأنوار لا بد وأن يتزود أصلها في الدنيا ثم يزداد في الآخرة إشراقاً. فأما أن يتجدد نور فلا، والحكم في هذا برجم الظنون مخطر، ولم ينكشف لنا فيه بعد ما يوثق به، فنسأل الله تعالى أن يزيدنا علماً ورشداً ويرينا الحق حقاً.
Indeed, look at Us, that We may take light [nur] from your light [nur] — it is said: Turn back behind you and seek a light [nur]. This indicates that the lights [anwar] — it is imperative that the root [asl] of them is provisioned in the world [dunya], then it increases in radiance [ishraq] in the Hereafter [akhira]. As for a light [nur] being newly created, then no. And the judgment [hukm] in this is by the casting of conjectures [zunun], perilous, and what is reliable [yuthqa bihi] in it has not yet been unveiled [inkashafa] to us. So we ask Allah, the Exalted, to increase us in knowledge ['ilm] and right guidance [rushd], and to show us the truth [haqq] as truth [haqq].

a.g: The hypocrites will call to the believers, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
اعلم أن قوله تعالى "ولكنكم فتنتم أنفسكم وتربضتم وارتبتم وغرتكم الأماني" الآية. كاف في ذم الغرور، وقد قال رسول الله ﭬ "حبذا نوم الأكياس وفطرهم كيف يغبنون سهر الحمقى واجتهادهم ولمثقال ذرة من صاحب تقوى ويقين أفضل من ملئ الأرض من المغترين"[1] وقال ﭬ "الكيس من دان نفسه وعمل لما بعد الموت، والأحمق من اتبع نفسه هواها وتمنى على الله"[2] وكل ما ورد في فضل العلم وذم الجهل فهو دليل على ذم الغرور، لأن الغرور عبارة عن بعض أنواع الجهل، إذ الجهل هو أن يعتقد الشيء ويراه على خلاف ما هو به، والغرور هو جهل إلا أن لك جهل ليس بغرور، بل يستدعي الغرور: مغروراً فيه مخصوصاً ومغروراً به وهو الذي يغره. فمهما كان المجهدل المعتقد شيئاً يوافق الهوى وكان السبب الموجب للجهل شبهة ومخيلة فاسدة يظن أنها دليل ولا تكون دليلاً سمي الجهل الحاصل به غروراً. فالغرور هو سكون النفس إلى ما يوافق الهوى، ويميل إليه الطبع عن شبهة وخدعة من الشيطان فمن اعتقد أنه على خير إما في العاجل أو في الآجل عن شبهة فاسدة فهو مغرور، وأكثر الناس يظنون بأنفسهم الخير وهم مخطئون فيه، فأكثر الناس إذن مغرورون وإن اختلفت أصناف غرورهم واختلفت درجاتهم، حتى كان غرور بعضهم أظهر وأشد من بعض، وأظهرها وأشدها غرور الكفار وغرور العصاة والفساق فنورد لهما أمثلة لحقيقة الغرور.
Know that His Exalted statement, "But you deceived yourselves [فتنتم أنفسكم] and you hesitated and doubted, and wishful delusions [الأماني] deceived you" (57:14) is sufficient in censuring delusion [الغرور]. And the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, said: "How excellent is the sleep of the intelligent and their breaking of fast! How they outstrip the vigil of the foolish and their striving! For a speck's weight of one possessing God-consciousness [تقوى] and certainty [يقين] is better than the earth's fill of the deluded [المغترين]." And he, peace be upon him, said: "The intelligent one is he who holds his soul [نفسه] to account and works for what is after death, and the foolish one is he who follows his soul's [نفسه] caprice and makes wishes upon God." And all that has come regarding the virtue of knowledge [العلم] and the censure of ignorance [الجهل] is proof for the censure of delusion [الغرور], for delusion [الغرور] is an expression for some types of ignorance [الجهل]. For ignorance [الجهل] is to believe a thing and see it contrary to what it truly is. And delusion [الغرور] is ignorance [الجهل], except that there is an ignorance [الجهل] which is not delusion [الغرور]. Rather, delusion [الغرور] necessitates: a specific thing deluded about [مغروراً فيه], and a deluder by which one is deluded [مغروراً به]. So whenever the thing mistakenly believed is something that conforms to caprice, and the cause necessitating the ignorance [الجهل] is a false semblance and deceptive imagination which is thought to be proof but is not proof, the ignorance [الجهل] that occurs by it is called delusion [الغرور]. Thus, delusion [الغرور] is the soul's [النفس] acquiescence to what conforms to caprice and to what the natural disposition inclines, due to a semblance and a deception from Satan. So whoever believes he is upon good, whether in the immediate or the ultimate, based on a false semblance, he is deluded [مغرور]. And most people think good of themselves, yet they are mistaken in it. Therefore, most people are deluded [مغرورون], even if the varieties of their delusion [غرورهم] differ and their degrees differ, such that the delusion [الغرور] of some of them is more manifest and severe than others. And the most manifest and severe of them is the delusion [الغرور] of the disbelievers and the delusion [الغرور] of the disobedient and the profligate. So we will present for these two examples of the reality of delusion [الغرور].

a.g: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلما كان في آخر عمره قرأ رجل بين يديه فاليوم لا يؤخذ منكم فدية الآية فرأيته قد ارتعد وكاد يسقط فلما عاد إلى حاله سألته عن ذلك فقال نعم يا حبيبي قد ضعفنا
Indeed, when he was at the end of his life, a man recited before him: "So today no ransom [fidya] will be taken from you..." (the verse). I saw him tremble violently and nearly fall. When he returned to his state, I asked him about that. He said: "Yes, my beloved, we have indeed grown weak."

a.g: Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allah and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.
Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.
Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned Allah a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.

And those who have believed in Allah and His messengers - those are [in the ranks of] the supporters of truth and the martyrs, with their Lord. For them is their reward and their light. But those who have disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of Hellfire.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فصدق التوحيد لعامة المؤمنين قال الله تعالى والذين آمنوا بالله ورسله أولئك هم الصديقون وصدق الطاعة لأهل العلم والورع وصدق المعرفة لأهل الولاية الذين هم أوتاد الأرض
Indeed, the truthfulness [sidq] of monotheism [tawhid] is for the general body of the believers [mu'minin]. Allah, the Exalted, says: "And those who believe in Allah and His messengers—it is they who are the truthful [siddiqun]." And the truthfulness [sidq] of obedience [ta'a] is for the people of knowledge ['ilm] and piety [wara']. And the truthfulness [sidq] of direct knowledge [ma'rifa] is for the people of divine friendship [wilaya], who are the pegs [awtad] of the earth.

a.g: Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allah and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم تظهر لذة الرياسة والعلو والتكاثر، وهي آخر لذات الدنيا وأعلاها وأقواها كما قال تعالى: " اعلموا أنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر " الآية.
Then appears the pleasure of leadership [ri'asa] and superiority ['uluww] and multiplication [takathur], and it is the last of the pleasures of the world [dunya] and its highest and strongest, as the Most High has said: "Know that the life of the world [dunya] is but play and amusement, and adornment, and mutual boasting among you, and multiplication [takathur]..." the verse.

a.g: Race toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن كنت تطلب أعلى الدرجات فاجتهد أن لا يسبقك أحد بطاعة الله تعالى فقد أمرك الله بالمسابقة والمنافسة فيها فقال تعالى: ﴿ سابقوا إلى مغفرة من ربكم ﴾ {} وقال تعالى: ﴿ وفى ذلك فليتنافس المتنافسون ﴾ {} والعجب أنه لو تقدم عليك أقرانك أو جيرانك بزيادة درهم أو بعلو بناء ثقل عليك ذلك وضاق به صدرك وتنغص بسبب الحسد عيشك وأحسن أحوالك أن تستقر فى الجنة وأنت لا تسلم فيها من أقوام يسبقونك بلطائف لا توازيها الدنيا بحذافيرها فقد قال أبو سعيد الخدرى: قال رسول الله ﭬ: (إن أهل الجنة ليتراءون أهل الغرف فوقهم كما تتراءون الكوكب الغائر فى الأفق من المشرق إلى المغرب لتفاضل ما بينهم قالوا يا رسول الله تلك منازل الأنبياء لا يبلغها غيرهم قال بلى والذى نفسى بيده رجال آمنوا بالله وصدقوا المرسلين[220]) وقال أيضا (إن أهل الدرجات العلى ليراهم من تحتهم كما ترون النجم الطالع فى أفق من آفاق السماء وإن أبا بكر وعمر منهم وأنعما[221]) وقال جابر: قال لنا رسول الله ﭬ: (ألا أحدثكم بغرف الجنة قال قلت بلى يا رسول الله صلى الله عليك بأبينا أنت وأمنا قال إن فى الجنة غرفا من أصناف الجوهر كله يرى ظاهرها من باطنها وباطنها من ظاهرها وفيها من النعيم واللذات والسرور ما لا عين رأت ولا أذن سمعت ولا خطر على قلب بشر قال يا رسول الله ولمن هذه الغرف قال لمن أفشى السلام وأطعم الطعام وأدام الصيام وصلى بالليل والناس نيام قال قلنا يا رسول الله ومن يطيق ذلك قال أمتى تطيق ذلك وسأخبركم عن ذلك من لقى أخاه فسلم عليه أو رد عليه فقد أفشى السلام ومن أطعم أهله وعياله من الطعام حتى يشبعهم فقد أطعم الطعام ومن صام شهر رمضان ومن كل شهر ثلاثة أيام فقد أدام الصيام ومن صلى العشاء الآخرة وصلى الغداة فى جماعة فقد صلى بالليل والناس نيام[222]) يعنى اليهود والنصارى والمجوس.
Indeed, if you seek the highest degrees [darajat], then strive that none precede you in obedience to Allah, the Exalted, for Allah has commanded you to race and compete in it. He, the Exalted, said: "Race towards forgiveness from your Lord." And He, the Exalted, said: "And for that let the competitors compete." And it is astonishing that if your peers or neighbors precede you by an extra dirham or by a taller building, that weighs heavily upon you and your chest tightens because of it, and your life becomes bitter due to envy. Yet, the best of your states is that you reside in Paradise [al-jannah] while you are not safe therein from people who precede you with subtleties [lata'if] that the entire world [al-dunya] cannot equal. Indeed, Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, the people of Paradise [ahl al-jannah] see the people of the elevated chambers above them as you see the setting star on the horizon from east to west, due to the superiority between them." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, those are the dwellings of the prophets, none but them attain them." He said: "Yes, by the One in Whose Hand is my soul, men who believed in Allah and believed the messengers." And he also said: "Indeed, the people of the highest degrees [darajat] are seen by those beneath them as you see the rising star on a horizon of the horizons of the sky. And Abu Bakr and 'Umar are among them, and how excellent they are." And Jabir said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to us: "Shall I not inform you of the chambers of Paradise [ghuraf al-jannah]?" I said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah, may my father and mother be sacrificed for you." He said: "Indeed, in Paradise are chambers of every kind of jewel, their exterior is seen from their interior and their interior from their exterior. And in them is bliss [na'im] and pleasures and joy that no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart [qalb] of any human." He said: "O Messenger of Allah, and for whom are these chambers?" He said: "For the one who spreads peace [afsha al-salam], feeds food [at'ama al-ta'am], persists in fasting [adama al-siyam], and prays at night while people are asleep." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, and who can bear that?" He said: "My nation can bear that, and I will inform you of it: Whoever meets his brother and greets him with peace or returns the greeting to him has spread peace. And whoever feeds his family and dependents from food until he satisfies them has fed food. And whoever fasts the month of Ramadan and three days from every month has persisted in fasting. And whoever prays the last 'Isha' prayer and prays the morning prayer in congregation has prayed at night while people are asleep." Meaning the Jews, the Christians, and the Magians.

a.g: No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy -
In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وينبغي أن يعول في باطنه على ثلاث علامات: العلامة الأولى: أن لا يفرح بموجود ولا يحزن على مفقود، كما قال تعالى: "لكيلا تأسوا على ما فاتكم ولا تفرحوا بما آتاكم" بل ينبغي أن يكون بالضد من ذلك: وهو أن يحزن بوجود المال ويفرح بفقده.
Indeed, in his innermost being, he should rely upon three signs [‘alamat]: The First Sign [al-‘alamah al-ula]: That he not rejoice [yafrah] over what is present [mawjud] nor grieve [yahzan] over what is lost [mafqud], as the Most High has said: "So that you may not grieve [tasa] over what has escaped you, nor exult [tafrahu] over what He has given you." Rather, he should be the opposite of that: which is to grieve [yahzan] at the presence of wealth [wujud al-mal] and to rejoice [yafrah] at its loss [faqd].

a.g: [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allah may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allah. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

O you who have believed, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

[This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allah and that [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
